subject: Cybersecurity
title: Ransomware-as-a-Service: Crime Made Easy
description: One-minute skill: Ransomware-as-a-Service: Crime Made Easy.

hook.text: You don't need to be a hacker to launch a ransomware attack. You just need $50 and a subscription.

buildup.text: Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) groups provide the malware, infrastructure, and even negotiation services..

discovery.text: RaaS operates like a franchise: the gang takes 20-30% of ransom payments, affiliates keep the rest.

twist.text: Some RaaS groups have helpdesks that walk victims through buying Bitcoin to pay the ransom. Customer service.

climax.text: RaaS industrialized cybercrime. Anyone can launch attacks. The barrier to entry is almost zero.

punchline.text: Ransomware now comes with a helpdesk and affiliate program.

quiz.question: How does Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) work?
options: Victims rent ransomware to protect themselves
Criminal groups provide ransomware tools to affiliates for a share of ransom payments
